basics.name: Omar Zaidi
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I take pride in my ability to learn quickly and adapt to new sectors. As an IT specialist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, I work with clients, providing creative solutions to large and small scale needs for project support. While my strongest skills are on the technical side, I enjoy opportunities to aid projects through management and teaching. I aim to better my community and others at large, and plan to complete my degree in computer science/philosophy. By leveraging engineering, business, ethics and finance skills, I hope to reach those in need in the ever technologically oriented future. I enjoy dialogues on just about anything from philosophy to health and music. Feel free to reach out and discuss any of my experiences.

experience.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa - University Laboratory School
highlights: Providing creative solutions to large and small scale needs for project support.

experience.summary:
Development:
-Leveraging knowledge JavaScript & HTML to fix bugs in a chrome extension
-Built a google Appscript to notify endpoints and management of expiring service and passwords
-Exposure to Ruby on Rails
Testing/Reporting:
-Testing various software in different environment to check for compatibilities with local resources.
-Utilize mail merge send out large scale communications
-Reported to team and follow up with vendors

Lawrence Berkeley is a scientific institution with a rich history of innovation.
*I have been fortunate to provide support to projects such as ALS and the particle accelerator.
*Installing of several large computing server nodes to be used in critical experiments.
*Maintenance of internal IT support websites by curating content and design.

Marin General Health is a premier health service in the north bay.
During my time with MGH, construction on an auxiliary building was underway.
My team was responsible for efficient and procedural installations of hospital workstations.
We managed the smooth deployment of over 600 workstations while adapting quickly to sudden drastic changes to building plans.

Laurel elementary school is a community of teachers and parents who deeply care about education.
*Provided friendly support to faculty and students
*Created/implemented a curriculum for student Pre-K to 5th grade
*Troubleshoot Mac/Windows software and hardware issues
*Rolled out new equipment, provisioned existing equipment and updates ensuring product functionality
I was the Onsite Technician for the school.
